title: NixOS Package PRs for findutils, util-linux-2.38.1, xdg, gcc-wrapper-12.2.0, yakuake, oxygen-sounds packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for findutils, util-linux-2.38.1, xdg, gcc-wrapper-12.2.0, yakuake, oxygen-sounds packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

It's too verbose to write every supported mime in config. I add a bash script to get matched mime types from shared-mime-info so that glob can be used.

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from https://repology.org/project/xdg-terminal-exec/versions.

meta.description for xdg-terminal-exec is: Reference implementation of the proposed XDG Default Terminal Execution Specification

meta.homepage for xdg-terminal-exec is: https://github.com/Vladimir-csp/xdg-terminal-exec

Updates performed
  • Version update
To inspect upstream changes
  • Compare changes on GitHub
Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 0.11.1 in filename of file in /nix/store/ycs8838smqq9ak2vpf3zk2z1vj3g795x-xdg-terminal-exec-0.11.1
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
2 total rebuild path(s)

2 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath

xdg-terminal-exec
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/ycs8838smqq9ak2vpf3zk2z1vj3g795x-xdg-terminal-exec-0.11.1 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A xdg-terminal-exec https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/b72d97202a09e6e1a070076a9814bd6ecd7a8bb9.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/b72d97202a09e6e1a070076a9814bd6ecd7a8bb9#xdg-terminal-exec

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/ycs8838smqq9ak2vpf3zk2z1vj3g795x-xdg-terminal-exec-0.11.1
ls -la /nix/store/ycs8838smqq9ak2vpf3zk2z1vj3g795x-xdg-terminal-exec-0.11.1/bin

Pre-merge build results

We have automatically built all packages that will get rebuilt due to
this change.

This gives evidence on whether the upgrade will break dependent packages.
Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

cc @quantenzitrone for testing.

Tip

As a maintainer, if your package is located under pkgs/by-name/*, you can comment @NixOS/nixpkgs-merge-bot merge to automatically merge this update using the nixpkgs-merge-bot.

items.title: xdg-terminal-exec: 0.10.1 -> 0.11.1

items.content_html:
"mimi" provides a replacement for xdg-open with different runtime dependencies than xdg-utils' canonical version, so resholve was (rightly) objecting to the difference.

Closes #316399.

Description of changes

  • update mimisrc and simplify meta.license since mimi has adopted MIT in march-linux/mimi@c5ad45e
  • provide separate solution for resholve when mimiSupport is enabled
  • add a test for mimiSupport to make it easier to avoid future breaks

This shouldn't trigger rebuilds since mimiSupport isn't enabled by default. nixpkgs-review on both Linux and macOS shows Nothing to be built.

You can confirm on a checkout with nix-build -A xdg-utils.tests.mimiSupport.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true

    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages

items.content_html:
Description of changes

xdg-desktop-portal-termfilechooser is a xdg-portal back-end for choosing files with your favorite file chooser. This is implemented by letting the user specify a shell script. This closes: #213438.

items.title: quakespasm: improve xdg desktop file, copy icons

items.content_html:
Ref: NixOS/nix#5588

This searches in $XDG_DATA_HOME/nix/profile everywhere where
previously we only looked in ~/.nix-profile, ditto for
.nix-channels and .nix-defexpr. This shouldn't break any
compatibility for now. It is highly recommended to use nixpkgs with
these changes if you want to use Nix with the XDG basedir PR, but not
doing so shouldn't result in any dramatic breakage -- in fact, NixOS
is perfectly usable without any user profile.
